1.name: Segmentation
1.description: Divide an object into independent parts

2.name: Taking out
2.description: Extract the disturbing part or property from an object
examples: Noise absorption in a quiet room

3.name: Local quality
3.description: Change an object's structure or environment from uniform to non-uniform

4.name: Asymmetry
4.description: Change the shape from symmetrical to asymmetrical
examples: Asymmetric tire tread for better traction

5.name: Merging
5.description: Bring closer together identical or similar objects

6.name: Universality
6.description: Make a part or object perform multiple functions
examples: Sofa that converts to a bed
Child's car safety seat that converts to a stroller

8.name: Anti-weight
8.description: Compensate for the weight of an object by merging with other objects that provide lift

9.name: Preliminary anti-action
9.description: If an action has both harmful and useful effects, precede it with anti-actions to reduce harm
examples: Buffer solution to prevent rapid pH change

10.name: Preliminary action
10.description: Perform a required change to an object completely or partially before it is needed

11.name: Beforehand cushioning
11.description: Prepare emergency means beforehand to compensate for the relatively low reliability of an object

12.name: Equipotentiality
12.description: Change the condition of the work in such a way that an object need not be raised or lowered

13.name: The other way round
13.description: Invert the action used to solve the problem
examples: Rotating the part instead of the tool
Turning a container upside-down to empty it
Moving platform instead of moving person

14.name: Spheroidality – Curvature
14.description: Instead of using rectilinear parts, surfaces, or forms, use curvilinear ones

15.name: Dynamics
15.description: Make an object or its environment adjustable for optimal performance at each stage of operation

16.name: Partial or excessive actions
16.description: If 100% of an objective is hard to achieve, use slightly less or slightly more to simplify the problem
examples: Overspray when painting, then remove excess

17.name: Another dimension
17.description: Move into an additional dimension, from 1D to 2D or from 2D to 3D

18.name: Mechanical vibration
18.description: Cause an object to oscillate or vibrate
examples: Vibrating concrete to remove air bubbles

19.name: Periodic action
19.description: Instead of continuous action, use periodic or pulsating actions

20.name: Continuity of useful action
20.description: Make all parts of an object work at full load all the time
examples: Flywheel to maintain energy during non-productive periods

21.name: Skipping
21.description: Conduct a process or certain stages at high speed
examples: High-speed cutting to avoid heat damage

22.name: Blessing in disguise
22.description: Use harmful factors to achieve a positive effect
examples: Waste heat for heating a building
Recycling harmful waste into useful products

23.name: Feedback
23.description: Introduce feedback to improve a process or action

24.name: Intermediary
24.description: Use an intermediary carrier article or intermediary process

25.name: Self-service
25.description: Make an object serve itself or organize it to perform auxiliary functions

26.name: Copying
26.description: Instead of an object that is unavailable, expensive, or fragile, use simpler and inexpensive copies

27.name: Cheap short-living objects
27.description: Replace an expensive object with multiple cheap ones, compromising certain qualities

28.name: Mechanics substitution
28.description: Replace a mechanical means with a sensory means
examples: Using optical, acoustic, or thermal measurement instead of mechanical measurement

29.name: Pneumatics and hydraulics
29.description: Use gas and liquid parts of an object instead of solid parts

30.name: Flexible shells and thin films
30.description: Use flexible shells and thin films instead of three-dimensional structures

31.name: Porous materials
31.description: Make an object porous or add porous elements
examples: Drilling holes in a structure to reduce weight

32.name: Color changes
32.description: Change the color of an object or its external environment

33.name: Homogeneity
33.description: Make objects interact with a given object of the same material

34.name: Discarding and recovering
34.description: Make portions of an object that have fulfilled their functions go away

35.name: Parameter changes
35.description: Change an object's physical state or concentration
examples: Freezing water to change its properties

36.name: Phase transitions
36.description: Use phenomena occurring during phase transitions

37.name: Thermal expansion
37.description: Use thermal expansion (or contraction) of materials

38.name: Strong oxidants
38.description: Replace common air with enriched air or pure oxygen

39.name: Inert atmosphere
39.description: Replace a normal environment with an inert one
examples: Argon atmosphere for welding reactive metals

40.name: Composite materials
40.description: Change from uniform to composite materials
